intro: Labatia micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered labatia, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features palmately lobed leaves and produces small, clustered flowers with five petals. Its fruit is a capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature. Labatia micrantha is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands.
